rename.from: Ubuntu: installed syncthing package post-installation script subprocess returned error exit status 1
rename.to: apt: installed syncthing package post-inst script returned exit status 1

body: Does the upgrade still go through or does it abort, staying at the old version?

Syncthing is upgraded successfully and working fine, but dpkg thinks it's still not configured because of this error. It can be easily fixed by running `apt-get -f install` when Syncthing is started, but I think the post-inst script can just ignore this error regardless of the current status of Syncthing
Sure, didn't mention that: It will of course be fixed (just PRed the tiny change). I was just wondering about the damage here: Whether it's still upgradable or not after encountering the error.

Hi, 

thanks for the fix !

Just a quick remark : I encountered the same issue:  despite running `apt-get -f install`, i cannot run `apt dist-upgrade `anymore (ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS).
So the fix will be precious :)

Thanks
GLLM

issue.title: Syncthing update to 1.16 fails on Debian Bullseye

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
### Does your log mention database corruption?

No

### Include required information

#### OS version and setup

$ cat /etc/debian_version 
bullseye/sid

$ cat sources.list.d/syncthing.list 
deb https://apt.syncthing.net/ syncthing stable

#### What happened

An apt upgrade produces the following output:

Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
All packages are up to date.
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
Calculating upgrade... Done
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
1 not fully installed or removed.
After this operation, 0 B of additional disk space will be used.
Setting up syncthing (1.16.0) ...
dpkg: error processing package syncthing (--configure):
 installed syncthing package post-installation script subprocess returned error exit status 1
Errors were encountered while processing:
 syncthing
needrestart is being skipped since dpkg has failed
E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (1)

#### What was expected

Not that error message.

Note that Syncthing does in fact appear to be v1.16, so the upgrade appears to have worked, but the above error is received, even after repeating the upgrade. I do not know the previous version from which I am upgrading, but unless there have been multiple releases in the last few weeks, it's whatever the previous version was.

rename.from: apt: installed syncthing package post-inst script returned exit status 1
rename.to: upgrade with apt fails in post-inst script

body:
v1.16.1 is out with a fix for this - just upgrade to that.

<strike>
If apt/dpkg marked the package as broken/not configured, you can fix this regardless of whether Syncthing is running or not like this: In the `/var/lib/dpkg/info/syncthing.postinst` file append ` || :` to the pkill line such that it looks like this:

```
    pkill -HUP -x syncthing || :
```

Then run `apt install -f` to fix the broken install.
</strike>

issue.title: debian package postinst failure

labels.name: bug

labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
### Include required information

Please be sure to include at least:

 - which version of Syncthing and what operating system you are using: **syncthing 1.16.0**
 - browser and version, if applicable: **not applicable**
 - what happened:
   - Upgrading syncthing package from apt.syncthing.net
   - no syncthing systemd service configured
   - no syncthing process running
   - postinst fails in `pkill -HUP -x syncthing`
 - what you expected to happen instead:
   - postinst should not fail if no syncthing processes are running, e.g. check for existing syncthing processes before HUPing them
 - any steps to reproduce the problem.
   - see "what happened"
